comment.author: 73313451@N00
comment._content: There doesn't appear to be a W Neill in that regiment on CWGC which is a sign he survived the Great War, a refreshing change.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
I did a search of the Medal Roll Index Cards using 'Neill' + 'Northumberland Fusiliers' and the following was the only result that matched:

Private Walter Neill 21620 Essex Regiment who transferred to the Northumberland Fusiliers, regimental number 55864. He was awarded the Victory & British medals but not the Star medal.

comment.author: 77788549@N05
comment._content:
Walter Neill, possibly born in Poplar (then in Essex) in 1898; and married in Romford, 11 miles away, in 1922?

Maybe a convenient long-shot, but 13th Battalion Essex Regiment, with other battalions in 6th Brigade, was disbanded in February 1918 and the soldiers re-allocated to new battalions as 6th Brigade was reconstituted.  On 6th February 1918 one of these new battalions coming into the 6th Brigade ORBAT was 17th Battalion Northumberland Fusiliers. This may account for Private W Neill becoming Fusilier W Neill.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: Just awaiting confirmation from family members that this is the Walter Neill b 1898 Poplar (tree listed on www.ancestry.co.uk)
